title: kingdom of God
comment: Or, less frequently, ``kingdom of heaven'', the kingly rule of God in the lives of people and nations. It refers to the recognition of the authority of God, rather than a definite geographical area, and begins with the ministry of Jesus Christ.

children.title: kingdom of God, coming of
children.comment: The kingdom of God comes into being wherever the kingly authority of God is acknowledged. Although God is always sovereign, Scripture looks to a future ``realm'' or ``reign'' of salvation. This has come in Christ and yet will come in its fulness only when Jesus Christ returns.

children.title: God is sovereign over Israel and over the whole earth
The coming reign of God

Its assocication with the coming of the Messiah

primaryrefs.comment: ``Son of Man'' was Jesus Christ's usual way of referring to himself.

children.title: The kingdom of God was central in the preaching of Jesus Christ and the apostles

seealsos.comment: Jesus Christ's instructions to the Twelve

children.title: The kingdom of God has come in Christ: it is present

primaryrefs.comment: Following the Jewish convention of avoiding the use of the divine name, Matthew usually speaks of ``the kingdom of heaven''.

children.title: The kingdom of God will come in its fulness only when Jesus Christ returns: it is future
kingdom of God, entry into
children.comment: Entering or inheriting the kingdom of God is the privilege of those who acknowledge and live by the rule of God and have become part of the new order of salvation and righteousness in Christ.

To be born again of God's Spirit

Entry is not based on outward appearances nor granted to all who claim to know the Lord
The kingdom of God is a kingdom of grace
It belongs to those qualified by God
It belongs to the poor and the poor in spirit

seealsos.comment: It is hard for the rich to enter the kingdom of God

children.title: It belongs to the childlike
It belongs to sinners
It belongs to those who are persecuted for Jesus Christ's sake
It belongs to Gentiles as well as to Jews

seealsos.comment: those initially uninvited represent the Gentiles

children.title: kingdom of God, characteristics of
children.comment: Those who have entered the kingdom must live according to its values, anticipating the reign of peace which will come when Jesus Christ returns.

children.title: The kingdom of God does not conform to the standards of this world
Those who inherit the kingdom of God are to bear its fruit
The kingdom of God is and will be a kingdom of peace

seealsos.comment: The Sermon on the Mount (Mt 5:1-7:29) is often thought of as a description of life in the kingdom.
